summary: This bill, the "Setting Consumer Standards for Lithium-Ion Batteries Act," mandates the Consumer Product Safety Commission (CPSC) to establish consumer safety standards for lithium-ion batteries used in consumer products as defined in the Consumer Product Safety Act. It adopts existing standards from ANSI/CAN/UL for light electric vehicles, eBikes, and personal e-mobility devices. The bill also outlines a process for reviewing and revising these standards. Finally, it requires a report to Congress within five years on incidents involving lithium-ion batteries in micromobility products.
